text: Septidelphis is an extinct genus of oceanic dolphins belonging to the family (Delphinidae). The type species is Septidelphis morii. ==Species== *†Septidelphis morii Bianucci 2013 ==Fossil records== This genus is known in the fossil records from the late Zanclean–early Piacenzian (Pliocene) (age range: from 3.81 to 3.19 million years ago). Fossils are found in the marine strata of Piedmont (northern Italy). Fossilworks Fossil skeleton of Septidelphis morii ==Description== This genus is characterized by a condylobasal length reaching about , by a long and narrow rostrum and by a wide premaxillae at the middle of rostrum. It shows an extreme posterior widening of the dorsal opening of the mesorostral canal.Giovanni Bianucci (2013). "Septidelphis morii, n. gen. et sp., from the Pliocene of Italy: new evidence of the explosive radiation of true dolphins (Odontoceti, Delphinidae)" Journal of Vertebrate Paleontology 33 (3): 722–740. doi:10.1080/02724634.2013.744757.The Coastal PaleontologistMorphobank ==References== Category:Oceanic dolphins
title: Septidelphis
